body.p: This list is featuring projects which are closely related to Apache Lenya.
Open Source Content Management Systems/Frameworks overviews can be found at oscom.org or cmsinfo.org.
More information on Cocoon-based projects can be found at http://cocoon.apache.org/2.0/link/projects.html.

section.title: CocoBlog
section.p: CocoBlog is a free weblogging software tool based on Apache Cocoon and Apache XIndice http://www.beblogging.com/blog/docs.

section.title: Cocoon
section.p: Apache Cocoon is an XML publishing framework that raises the usage of XML and XSLT technologies for server applications to a new level. Designed for performance and scalability around pipelined SAX processing, Cocoon offers a flexible environment based on a separation of concerns between content, logic, and style. To top this all off, Cocoons centralized configuration system and sophisticated caching help you to create, deploy, and maintain rock-solid XML server applications.

section.title: Maverick
section.p: Maverick is a Model-View-Controller (aka "Model 2") framework for web publishing using Java and J2EE. It is a minimalist framework which focuses solely on MVC logic, allowing you to generate presentation using a variety of templating and transformation technologies.

section.title: Slide
section.p: The Slide project main module is a Content Management and Integration System, which can be seen as a low-level content management framework. Conceptually, it provides a hierarchical organization of binary content which can be stored into arbitrary, heterogenous, distributed data stores. In addition, Slide integrates security, locking, versioning, as well as many other services.
